flashcards.english: Nguuyū (Colobus monkey), Nūgū (Baboon), Ngĩma (Sykes monkey), Thakwe (Chimpanzee)
flashcards.notes: Complete primate vocabulary. Nguuyū is the black and white colobus, Ngĩma is Sykes/blue monkey. Part of wildlife/safari vocabulary

flashcards.english: Ndũiga (giraffe), Njogu (elephant), Wambũĩ mĩcore/njagĩ (zebra), Nyaga (ostrich), Huria (rhinoceros), Mũrũthĩ (lion), Ngatata (wildebeest), Nyũtũ (cheetah), Hiti (hyena), Nguuo (hippo), Ngarĩ (leopard)
flashcards.notes: Complete safari/wild animals vocabulary. Nyamũ cĩa gĩthaka = wild animals (animals of the wilderness). Covers big five and other iconic African wildlife

flashcards.english: Kĩbũyũ (flask), Ndigithũ (water pot), Thitobu (stove), Tuuba (file), Burinji (fridge), Tawa (lamp), Toci (torch), Ngwatĩra (tin lamp), Ũrĩrĩ (bed/woman's bed), Gĩtanda (bed), Thagĩri (charcoal stove), Makara/ikara (charcoal), Thoo (saw), Rũgĩo (hot pan/griddle), Mũindũri (wooden ladle)
flashcards.notes: Mix of traditional and modern household items. Ũrĩrĩ traditionally refers to a woman's bed/room. Shows cultural evolution with borrowed words (Burinji from fridge, Toci from torch)

flashcards.kikuyu: Household Items - Kitchen & Dining (Indo cia nyũmba)
flashcards.english: Riiko/Mariiko (stove/cooker), Metha (table), Gĩtĩ/Ĩtĩ (chair), Mwaburi/Mĩaburi (umbrella), Nyũngũ (traditional cooking pot), Thaani (plates), Kahĩũ/Tũhĩũ (knife), Njagĩ (jug), Hũma (fork), Gĩcĩko/Ĩcĩko (spoon), Mbakũrĩ (bowl), Mũcuba/Mĩcuba (bottle), Mbũthũ (decorated gourd), Thaburia (saucepan), Ngĩrathĩ (glass), Kĩĩhũrĩ/ciĩhũrĩ (plain gourd/calabash)
flashcards.notes: Complete kitchen/dining vocabulary with singular/plural forms. Indo cia nyũmba = things of the house. Shows traditional items (Mbũthũ, Kĩĩhũrĩ) alongside modern utensils
Complete reptile and amphibian vocabulary. Nyoka is general term for snake. Context: Andīkai marītwa nyamū ciathī (write names of snakes in comments)

flashcards.english: Mũtwee/Mîtwe (head), Njũrĩrĩ/Njũîrĩ (hair), Rũbutu/Mbutu (eyebrow), Riitho/Maitho (eye), Gũtũ/Matũ (ear), Inĩũrũ/Manĩũrũ (nose), Igego/Magego (teeth), Kîromo/Iromo (lips), Kĩreru/Ireru (chin), Ngingo (neck), Gîthũri/Îthũri (chest), Kĩande/Ciande (shoulder), Guoko/Moko (arm), Nda (stomach), Rũhĩ/Hĩ (hand), Njohero (waist), Îru/Maru (knee), Kĩara/Twara (fingers/toes), Kũgũrũ/Magũrũ (leg), Ikĩnya/Makĩnya (foot), Kanua/Tũnua (mouth)
flashcards.notes: Complete body parts with singular/plural forms. Cĩuga cia mwĩrĩ = parts of the body. Note: Kĩara/Twara serves for both fingers and toes. Some parts invariant in plural (Nda, Ngingo, Njohero)
